paper_abstract: The antenna design is a complicated and time-consuming procedure. This work explores using support vector machines (SVMs), a statistical learning theory based on the structural risk minimization principle and has a great generalization capability, as a fast and accurate tool in the antenna design. As examples, SVMs is used to design a rectangular patch antenna and a rectangular patch antenna array. Results show, after an appropriate training, SVMs is able to effectively design antennas with high accuracy. (C) 2010 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Int J RF and Microwave CAE 21:85-90, 2011.
paper_title: Application of Support Vector Machines to the Antenna Design
